word_mean: 催化〔作用〕：在化学反应或过程中，由于不被消耗的物质的存在，所引起的化学反应或过程的速度变快
负催化〔作用〕(negative catalysis)是指由这样一种物质的存在而使某一反应或过程减慢或受到抑制

sentence.Network_en: In specific acid catalysis, the undissociated acids do not contribute.
sentence.Network_cn: 在特殊的酸催化中, 不离解的酸不起作用.

sentence.Network_en: The corresponding reaction of acetaldehyde is subject to general base catalysis.
sentence.Network_cn: 乙醛相应的反应服从广义的碱催化.

sentence.Network_en: Catalysis has increased the rate of reaction.
sentence.Network_cn: 催化作用提高了反应的速度.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: from modern Latin, from Greek katalusis, from kataluein 'dissolve', from kata- 'down' + luein 'loosen'

entry.def: Catalysis is the speeding up of a chemical reaction by adding a catalyst to it.

means.word_mean: 1. acceleration of a chemical reaction induced the presence of material that is chemically unchanged at the end of the reaction;

sentences.sentence: "of the top 50 commodity chemicals, 30 are created directly by catalysis and another 6 are made from raw materials that are catalytically produced"
